availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James L. Conner (Boone County, Kentucky constable and justice of the peace)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky constable and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Son of Paschal Conner and Nelly Conner. Married to America A. Conner. Father of Samuel H. Conner. Constable of Florence, Kentucky, in 1860. Justice of the peace in the 4th District of Boone County in 1865.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence, p. 9; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Boone County, Florence, p. 4; Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910). Microfilm rolls #994027-994058. Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky, Film# 994028, Boone County (accessed on ancestry.com); KYR-0001-007-0359.
